title: The public are right to ignore the deliberate pessimism peddled by the downbeat elite
text:
Climate change and mass extinction. Brexit blues. Rising crime and economic uncertainty. Oceans polluted by plastic. Stress induced by social media.

It’s easy to think that the world is getting worse, and that we should all be sick with worry. Our newsfeeds are an unrelenting invitation to fear the worst.

But we aren’t fretting. In fact the world is on the up and people in Britain feel happier and less anxious than before.

According to the Office of National Statistics "happiness rating", we Brits are actually feeling increasingly upbeat. Surprised? You shouldn’t be. By almost every measure, life is better for most Brits in 2019 than in any previous year.
